poem:
Title: "Of Childhood Shades"

Little brown boy, 
birthed in Cairo, 
a far cry from the cold 
Northern Lull,
A speak twisted in new tongues,
taste of Ireland on your lips.
Chasing years, in a wheelchair bound, 
In a rain-touched English land. 
A moniker, a misshapen jest, 
Yet ever resilient, you rest.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Ash Atalla: ‘I cry easily. I get nostalgic about the passing of years’ I was born in Cairo and moved to Northern Ireland when I was two for my parents’ work – they’re both doctors. I’d open my mouth and this really manic Northern Irish accent would come out, which was even more incongruous for a little brown boy in a wheelchair. When my family moved to England, my nickname at school was IRA.I was". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
